You can, but you'd still need the disc in which to burn it. 

Now, I'm gonna speculate (or go out on a limb, here, don't take offense to it) to say that you want a crack to it, and I'm sure there are experienced program crackers out there, but the thing is, I've probably experienced more crashing with cracked programs than with just burning it to a DVD.

Granted, Oblivion isn't exactly the most STABLE of Bethsoft games, but at least you have insurance that it's not passing the disc-check to where something crucial to the program might want to access (say, the Levelup/Attributes menu, or the loading screen/cards, that seems to access the disc alot).

Of course, if you DO want to crack it, by all means, do so, I have no control over your decisions, I'm just lookin' out for the actions and consequences.

Runs perfectly fine with mods, so long as you don't mess with the LOD meshes (In other words, don't generate new LOD meshes, makes Oblivion lag like crazy, stick with the ones you got), and it should run perfectly smoothly.

I also have a modified INI that can put actor/object/specular/shadow fades waaay above the normal limits, while running everything on max (well, except HDR, that seems to be broken for me, auto-adjusts the skybox all white).

Again, I'm sure you'll be fine, it is a fairly old game by now.
